H0.text: The Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) is responsible for ensuring the safety of the country's drinking water in the United States.

H1.text: Food and Drug Administration (FDA) is responsible for ensuring the safety of the country's drinking water in the United States.

H2.text: National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA) is responsible for ensuring the safety of the country's drinking water in the United States.

H3.text: Center for Disease Control (CDC) is responsible for ensuring the safety of the country's drinking water in the United States.

A4.text: EPA oversees states, local governments and water suppliers to enforce the standards under the Safe Drinking Water Act.

A5.text: EPA ensures safe drinking water for the public, by setting standards for more than 148,000 public water systems nationwide.
